key_points: Alex Padilla, former Los Angeles City Councilman, was appointed by Gov. Gavin Newsom to fill the U.S. Senate seat vacated by Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.
Padilla resigned as California secretary of state to assume his new role in the Senate.
He will be the first Latino to represent California in the U.S. Senate.
Kamala Harris formally resigned her Senate seat ahead of her inauguration with President-elect Joe Biden.
Padilla has a background in both local and state government, having served on the Los Angeles City Council and in the California state Senate.
Before his political career, Padilla earned a degree in mechanical engineering and worked for Hughes Aircraft.
Security has been increased ahead of Biden's inauguration due to threats against the U.S. Capitol and state capitals.
Charles Marino, CEO of Sentinel Security Solutions, discusses the enhanced security measures.
Gov. Newsom nominated Shirley Weber to succeed Padilla as secretary of state, potentially making her the first Black woman to hold that position.
Padilla's deputy, James Schwab, will serve as acting secretary of state until Weber's confirmation.
